page.title: 07Interview with local farmer
page.content: On June 24th 1985 we visited a local farm. It is called Lower Farm and its owner is Mr. Butler. The farm has been in the family for 150 years but Mr. Butler has only been working on the farm for 5 years. He owns 340 acres of land which is mostly arable. He grows wheat, barley and broad beans. He also keeps two bee hives. The farm was built in 1740 but Mr. Butler mentioned that the house that was on the site before the farm was in the Domesday Book. In Mr. Butler's leisure time he shoots pheasants. His neighbours owned the rest of the land and they were hay-making. Mr. Butler owns two tractors and one combine harvester. by Victoria Atkinson and Rachael Edmunds
